de.esoco.lib.collection

Class ObservableList<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<T>
      • de.esoco.lib.collection.AbstractObservableCollection<E,java.util.List<E>,ListEvent<E>>
        • de.esoco.lib.collection.ObservableList<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.esoco.lib.event.EventSource<ListEvent<E>>, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Iterable<E>, java.util.Collection<E>, java.util.List<E>, java.util.RandomAccess

    public class ObservableList<E>
extends AbstractObservableCollection<E,java.util.List<E>,ListEvent<E>>
implements java.util.List<E>, de.esoco.lib.event.EventSource<ListEvent<E>>, java.io.Serializable, java.util.RandomAccess
    A list implementation that can be observed for changes.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • createEvent

        protected ListEvent<E> createEvent(de.esoco.lib.event.ElementEvent.EventType rType,
                                   E rElement,
                                   E rUpdateValue,
                                   int nIndex)
        Must be implemented by subclasses to create a new event object. This method will only be invoked if listeners have been registered on this observable collection instance, so implementations need not test this. See the method AbstractObservableCollection.notifyListeners(ElementEvent.EventType, Object, Object, int) for more details.
        Specified by:
        createEvent in class AbstractObservableCollection<E,java.util.List<E>,ListEvent<E>>
        Parameters:
        rType - The type of event
        rElement - The element affected by the event
        rUpdateValue - The new element value in case of an update event
        nIndex - The position index for random access collections
        Returns:
        A new event object
